turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: And what's that?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: How about you give us what you have and leave.

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Am I speaking English here?  How-about-you-give-us-what-you- have-and-leave?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: What is this?  Don't be stupid man...

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: First you question my integrity, then you call me stupid...  ...that hurts, son.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: All right, deputies, take care, don't let your meat loaf.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Don't worry the real men are in charge now.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Speaking of which that reminds me I have to bring something home or eat Sally's meatloaf again, and I don't think I could stand that.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Cause we got footprints leading into that brush, I want to see where it leads...  Jesus, seven dead.  I'll tell you I've never seen carnage like this in all my seventeen years of sheriffing these parts.  I don't like it.  Not in my jurisdiction.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What makes you say that?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: We had hounds down at the scene, the footprint trail was a bust. And there were no other tire tracks in the vicinity.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: This just might be our ticket!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: What do you think about all this?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Hell, I don't know.  If I had some input I'd offer it up.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I guess we can get started.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I wanted to ask you some questions about last night.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: He kept a recording of all such transactions in order to keep track of who's who, what was said, what's happening.  I contacted your local coroner, and he found it taped to his back.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: That's news to me.  So it's over at Jesse's office?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yeah.  I told him I'd be there before five.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Excellent. I'll go down with you.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Well nothing audible to us.  Maybe the lab can pick something up.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Damn! MARTIN I'm sorry to have dragged you all the way down here for that.  I thought maybe it would help. Booth lets out an inaudible deep breath -- Earl immediately plays up to Martin, clearly relieved --

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well we'd like to help you in any way we can.  We're all in this together, as law enforcement officers.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: We appreciate that.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Uh, no...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Don't you think I would have told you that!

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Maybe.  Maybe not.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: What are you getting at?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Well, unfortunately Denning's not here to tell us, but I would say someone got their hands on that tape and switched it.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Why would someone do that?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Because they don't want anyone to hear what's on it, obviously.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Oh that was Agent Wallace.  We're going to check into something.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Maybe I should come along.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Don't you have to be here?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Hell no. besides I'm just a radio call away if something happens. I feel I should keep abreast of what happens, seeing it's my jurisdiction and all.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Mm-hmm...

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: We don't know.  Whoever got this payload together has one hell of a laundering system.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Have you known this all along?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Well you can understand why we didn't say anything.  If word got out that we had a track on the money it would only work against us.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well yes I understand that, we don't want them high-tailing it out of here.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Sheriff Hogan --

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Dwayne.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Dwayne...  It is imperative that we keep this confidential.	Now we know someone's out there.  Very close. It may even be the son of a bitch that killed my partner.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Fine.  The information doesn't leave this room.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: OK...this is good.  Our first solid lead.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Did you say After Midnight?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Mr. Curtis called us this afternoon. The bills arrived at this branch from a cash drop.  Came through a store called After Midnight.  There's only four employees, none of them can tell us who passed them.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Is this marked money, or what?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Some of it.  Denning only handled a small portion of the total, but it looks like this was one of his bills.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: So there was money there!  Who the hell's money is it?!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: What the hell is that, some kind of porno store or something?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Not exactly.  It's some lingerie store on the strip.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Lingerie...

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Yeah, racy stuff, you know the kind, right?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Sure... DISSOLVE TO EXT HOGAN HOUSE -- NIGHT

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Anything I can help you with?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well I just uh, you know...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I have an anniversary coming up, thought I'd buy her something special.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Anything...specific?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well I don't know...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Sixty five...  Jeez Louise!

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: We are having a sale on some items over here --

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Yeah, she is.  She comes up to about here on me.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Hmmm...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I don't suppose you've seen her.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Have I seen her?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Shopping here?

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: No, I can't say that I have.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Let's see...do you know her cup size?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Uh...C?

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: C?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Yeah I'd say C...C.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Do you know...34 C?  32 C?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: No I don't.  You sure you havent seen her?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well...I should have done a little homework, getting all the sizes, and what not.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I'm just not very good...with all of this stuff.

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Oh, that's ok, a lot of men feel uncomfortable when they come in here.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: A lot of men come in here?

turns.speaker: SALESPERSON
turns.text: Oh yeah.  Between here and Vegas we get a lot of customers.  All types.  Even had an officer, just like you.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Just goes to show you.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I mean at least pick a more discreet place, the scalp, under the armpit, under the tongue, someplace where the trained eye wont immediately look.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Damn its hot in here...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: He probably figured she was on her way out anyhow, no drugs in her system, no foul play.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Very clumsy, very clumsy.  Id have found it in a minute.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: All right youre the super sleuth, what do you want, a medal?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: No.  But what I would like is the forty dollars you owe me, and Im a busy man.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Dammit youre persistent.  I dont want to listen to this anymore.  No more bets with you.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Aw, now thats gonna take time to clear!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Take it or leave it.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Do you even have a girlfriend, Jesse?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Sort of.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: She's not his type.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah.  That's all I need, to become one of your in-laws.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Jesse?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah whaddya want?.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm at a payphone in Vegas.  What's up?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Vegas!  Can you hightail it back here by three o'clock?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well, we got the DEA coming down here again, I don't know, sounds to me like they got some more questions they want to ask us.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: About what?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well they really didn't go into any details on the phone, but they did ask for you, and I figure we should try to help them out as best we can.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Uh, sure.  I hear you.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: So be here at three.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'll do my best...that doesn't give me much time.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: I  have complete faith in you. But don't you go speeding.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Yeah...see you at three.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Nice of you to join us.  I did say three o'clock, didn't I?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Well I'm here now.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Something wrong, Jesse?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: No.  Something wrong with you Dwayne?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: You walked in here looking like you just ate a shit sandwich.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Well, I just got a lot of things on my mind is all.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Hey where's the hot pad?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Where's the hot back -- the therapeutic pad thing?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I can't hear a word you're saying!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It was going to be a surprise!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: A surprise huh?  Well I don't like any surprises, especially if I'm forking over the loot for them!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: What are you saying?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm saying you're about as romantic as a bag of sand.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Watch that.  Watch that tone.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Nothing.  Nothing's the matter. SALLY Aren't you going to tell how your day went?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Not much to tell.  Nothing really happened.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: That hasn't stopped you before.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Suppose I'm not exciting enough for you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I didn't say that.  You did.

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Well you might as well say it. Mister Small Time...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Just trying to be civil Dwayne.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Don't you want to hear about my day?

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Yeah let's hear about your day.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Well I got the tires rotated, I went shopping, and I made dinner.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Whatever...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Look I worked all day, I'm tired as hell and I want to sit and eat in peace!  Is that asking too much?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: No, Dwayne, you go ahead and relax, have a six pack and fall asleep in front of the TV, and come upstairs and pass out.  And do it all over again tomorrow!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Save me the sermon.  I've heard it all before, it's boring.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It certainly is...

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: You shut your mouth you son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Dwayne put the gun down --

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Shut up!!!  Slut!!!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: You'd do this to me?!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Dwayne -

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: You'd do this to me!

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Dwayne please calm down!

turns.speaker: DWAYNE
turns.text: Calm down --

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Hey we're all friends, right? Friends don't squeal on friends, that's not what Jesse Segundo is all about.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Then what the hell are you all about?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'll settle for a third of that.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: And if we refuse?  Your tampering with evidence isn't exactly a misdemeanor, did you ever consider that?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: True, but neither is attempted murder. In fact I'd say that's considerably worse, wouldn't you, Earl?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We're out of here.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Right behind you.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Meet me at the Tumbleweed Diner.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Just do it!  Meet me there, now.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm not asking.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well you're not getting, either.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Listen -

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What do you mean?  You gambled it?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I was on a roll!  Im a little overextended now.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Oh Jesus Christ...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: So I want the money and I want it now.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well you can't have it.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You want to see how more unglued I can get?  Try me.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're never getting that much.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I think I am.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: What the hell are you doing, you crazy some bitches --

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We're gonna talk.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't suppose you'll tell us where the tape is.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Well it's not here -- you're wasting your time and you're pissing me off!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Don't hurt me.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We gotta, Jesse.  It's tough, but you didn't leave us any choice.  We gotta know where the tapes are.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Easy to purchase, hard to detect. Too much potassium can kill a man.  Just have to...pick a discreet spot.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Stop!  Stop!  I don't need the money.  You can have it all.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Hi ma.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: I didn't know you were coming.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I was in the neighborhood.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Is that the mail?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: How's work?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well, same ol' same ol'.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: People have been asking me about that story in the paper.  I told them you were the first person on the scene.  They were asking me for all the details.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: It was pretty gory ma, let me tell you.  But you have to turn all that off, and do your job, just like pop used to say.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Did they ever find out who they were?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Nope. If you're a criminal you don't carry ID, and if you do you're a damn fool.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: I tell you this world just keeps getting more and more violent.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: At least around here it does.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Are you hungry?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yeah sure I'll grab something before I go...  Hey -- I've got a surprise.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: You do?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: There was this raffle going on at the station, some charity or church was running it, I forget, so I figure what the hell put in my five bucks...

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: And what happened?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well basically I forgot about it, you know, you never win these things, but this time, well...

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Well what do you know!  An air conditioner.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: And not just any air conditioner. This baby sells for over six hundred dollars retail.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: That's great Earl!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yep, fifteen thousand BTU's, enough to cool off this whole place.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: This whole place?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yeah.  Figured you could have it.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Don't you want it?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Ah, hell I'll get one soon enough.  Besides, I want you to have it.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Well I don't know --

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You've done without it long enough, ma.

turns.speaker: EARL'S MOTHER
turns.text: Thank you honey.  are you sure you don't want it?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Absolutely positively.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You want to hear the good news first, or the bad news?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Give me the bad news.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: We retrieved a few things from the trunk, including a steamer trunk, or the remnants of a trunk, the brass clips and so forth.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Anything in it?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Money.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: But nowhere near three million dollars worth.  I would say maybe twenty thousand.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: There was more than that.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Not in the trunk.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: That doesn't tell us much. Did you run a check on the gas like I told you?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: Yeah, we did.  It was unleaded, high octane.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: So...what's the good news?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: That fire was set.  Deliberately. And probably not by anyone found at the scene.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: So someone did get away.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I don't know how else you'd explain it.  The coroner's estimated time of death for everyone there was long before this fire started, unless of course Denning started it, and that doesn't make much sense.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: No, it doesn't.  Neither does his blank tape.  Any news on that?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: We're doing a check on the manufacturers'	serial number, see if there were other defective tapes in the bunch.  What's your take on these local boys?  Are they providing any answers?

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: He didn't make it into work, and he's not home.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: I knew it, I knew it all along - shit!

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: You think he skipped town?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: We're going to find out.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: What do you think?  Heart attack?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: This isn't right...

turns.speaker: WALLACE
turns.text: I'm not getting an answer.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Not getting an answer?  For Christ's sake!  Call 911!  Let's get it locked down here!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN DIEL
turns.text: Is it true, Carter?  Are you in Hong Kong right now?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Hong Kong?  I'm not in Hong Kong.  I'm in Hollywood -- right at Sunset and Vine, two minutes from the station.  How about I pick you up right now and take you to dinner?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN DIEL
turns.text: It's nine-thirty in the morning.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Did I say dinner?  I meant diner. Biscuits and gravy, you love that shit.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN DIEL
turns.text: Do you know what happened yesterday, Carter?  I was officially nominated for the Commissioner's post for the LAPD. There was a dinner last night, two hundred LAPD officers were there.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Two hundred cops?  Was Mario Sanchez there?  He owes me money.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN DIEL
turns.text: I've waited my whole life for this job, but I don't have a shot in hell of getting it.  Do you know why?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Is it because of the hookers, sir?  You tell them there's no crime in being lonely.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN DIEL
turns.text: No, Carter.  The reason I'm screwed is because the entire department is about to find out the stolen credit cards we impounded were used to buy two first class upgrades to Hong Kong.  And what the hell is Heaven on Earth?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Sir, I'm working on a big case over here -- and by the time I get back they're gonna make you Governor.  Captain, you there?  Hello?  Shit!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: CRAPS DEALER
turns.text: Those are five hundred dollar chips.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Did you give me five-hundred dollar chips because I'm black?

turns.speaker: CRAPS DEALER
turns.text: No, I just assumed...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: You assumed a brother coming in here can only afford five-hundred dollars a roll, is that right?  Are you a racist?

turns.speaker: CRAPS DEALER
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Everyone else at the table has thousand dollar chips, but the black man gets the nickel, is that it?  Did my people survive two-hundred years of slavery so you could send us back to the cotton fields with five-hundred dollar chips? Do I look like Chicken George to you?

turns.speaker: CRAPS DEALER
turns.text: Winner six!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How much is that?

turns.speaker: CRAPS DEALER
turns.text: Two-hundred thousand!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Two-hundred thousand dollars?  Who wants a hundred dollars?

turns.speaker: CRAPS DEALER
turns.text: Winner!  Four, winner!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'm up a hundred and fifty-grand. That's a Ferrari.  Do they sell those here in the gift shop?  Somebody cash me out!

turns.speaker: DOORMAN #1
turns.text: Invitation, please.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'm with the band.  I'm the lead singer.

turns.speaker: DOORMAN #1
turns.text: The band has been playing over an hour.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I got held up at a wedding in Tai Koo. Ricky here yet, I need to get his requests.

turns.speaker: DOORMAN #1
turns.text: Wait.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Last party all he wanted was Sting -- not one person danced.  Tonight I'm doing Superfreak, I don't care what he says.  Where is he?

turns.speaker: DOORMAN #1
turns.text: Mr. Tan is not to be disturbed by the help.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Hear you got your ass kicked in Hong Kong, James.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What??  Where'd you hear that?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: I got my sources.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: And I got mine, meaning you.  Nice how that works out.  I'm serious this time, I'm closing this place down.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: James, you see my kids back there?  You know how much I'm paying for private school?  How can you come in here with this attitude, you being little Chang's godfather?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Little Chang is gonna have to go visit his daddy in jail if you don't cooperate.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Jail!?  James, you better back off. Badge or no badge, I'll kick your ass.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'd like to see you try.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Look, I need some info and I don't have time to play around.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: Is this about the funny money?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How'd you know?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: You've been asking loud questions in all the wrong places all morning.  How come you always save me for last, James? When are you gonna learn.  Shit don't happen I don't know about.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: So tell me what you know.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: I know Teddy Wu is cranking out a pretty good double sawbuck -- but you knew that too, didn't you?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yeah.  We already been there.  This is big, Kenny.  Benjamins.  Secret Service calls 'em superbills.  Banks can't even tell the difference.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: One of my regulars lost fifty thousand dollars at the table here last week.  I was about to send my boys down to tune his ass up, when the guy comes in and pays off the whole thing.  Including the vig -- brand new sequential hundred dollar bills.  I knew something was wrong.  Cause this guy's got a regular job, no way he comes up with fifty grand in cash. But I tested the bills, infrared.  The whole thing.  And they checked out. 100%.

turns.speaker: KENNY
turns.text: I knew it.  The guy's name is Zing.  He works at the kitchen at Reign Plaza.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: All right, Kenny.  Thanks.  You're off the hook.  For now.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How you doing, baby?  My name is Prince Mubutu from Nigeria.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Isabella Molina, from San Juan.  That seat is taken.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: San Juan!  You must know my good friend Pedro Martinez Hernandez Hector Elizondo.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'm sorry, you looked like you traveled in the best circles.  But hey, I understand.  Make yourself at home, Isabella.  Champagne, caviar, whatever you want.  My ship is your ship.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: This is your ship?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's right.  I'm the owner, the Captain -- you can call me El Capitan.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: El Capitan?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I don't want to play games with you, Isabella.  I like you.  I can see myself with you -- in one of those bathrooms over there in about five minutes.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Well, I'm very tempted.  It's such a beautiful yacht.  What's it called?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Called?  What's my ship called?  Well...it's called the S.S. Minnow Johnson.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: The S.S. Minow Johnson.  Funny, the name on the back was "Red Dragon."

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Red Dragon?  You sure about that?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I'm sure, because this is my friend's yacht.  And it's his party.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Your friend's ship?  Oh, man.  I must've walked onto the wrong yacht.  I knew there was a reason my keys didn't work.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: You see, no bomb.  Now stay away before I throw you both in jail for obstruction.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Throw us in jail?  I'm about to bust you right now.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: I'm an undercover agent for the United States Secret Service.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How do we know you're not lying?  Let me see your badge.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Yeah, that's right.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: We need to get out of sight.  Come down to my suite.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: Look, I've been working this case for months now...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: So what's your story?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: They think I'm a crooked customs agent.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: It's a myth.  Some kind of counterfeit.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: It's much more than a counterfeit.  14 out of 15 world banks can't tell the difference.  The paper is Crane linen blend -- and the bills are printed on U.S. Intaglio presses.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: How're they getting into the U.S. Mint to use the presses?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: In 1959, the United States was very friendly with the Shah of Iran.  We wanted his oil, so for the Shah's birthday, the government gave him a gift -- a U.S. Treasury Intaglio press.  The only one to ever leave the country. Five years ago Ricky Tan bought that press on the black market.

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: They use an optical transfer ink from India that burns red -- the real ink burns black.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: What the hell are they going to do with a hundred million dollars in funny money?

turns.speaker: ISABELLA
turns.text: The real question is, where are the plates?  If we can find the plates, we can stop the whole operation.

turns.speaker: RICKY TAN
turns.text: I'm busy at the moment.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I said get on your feet!

turns.speaker: RICKY TAN
turns.text: I know you, Detective Carter, right? You're Lee's American friend.  Enjoying your visit?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'm Lee's new muscle, his right arm -- and don't let the robe fool you.  This is the only color they had left.  Now get up!

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Let's go.  I've got girls and chicken and hot oil waiting for me.

turns.speaker: RICKY TAN
turns.text: I don't think so...

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I'd like to pay you for that laptop.

turns.speaker: RICKY TAN
turns.text: It's no problem.  But I must excuse myself, inspector.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's Chief Inspector, he got promoted.

turns.speaker: RICKY TAN
turns.text: Could you have your partner wait for us outside?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: I ain't his partner, I'm a tourist.  I got proof.  See, I got a mini-bar key.

turns.speaker: RICKY TAN
turns.text: Would you like me to tell you how your father died?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Lee, you okay?

turns.speaker: RICKY TAN
turns.text: Do you have it in you, Lee?  Or are you gonna spend the rest of your life hiding like your father?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: C'mon, Lee.  He's going to jail.  You won, now just put the gun down.

turns.speaker: HOSTESS
turns.text: Oh, you American?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: HOSTESS
turns.text: You bring American money?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Never leave home without it.  Lee, this one's on me.  You save your money.

turns.speaker: HOSTESS
turns.text: You get massage from Chinese girl before?

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: No.  It's my first time.

turns.speaker: HOSTESS
turns.text: You pick any girl for you and your friend.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: Any girl?  Okay.  Let's start with that one.

turns.speaker: HOSTESS
turns.text: Oh yes, she's very nice.

turns.speaker: CARTER
turns.text: She is nice.  But I am very tense.  I'm gonna need a lot of massages.  I'll take that one, too.  How you doin', baby? And...that one in pink.  She can do my feet.
